diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Cholecystitis, Atrial fibrillation, OSA, obesity-hypoventilation syndrome, COPD, DMII, CAD s/p CABG
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with intermittent LUQ abdominal pain that radiated to the RUQ, accompanied by fever and elevated lipase levels. Ultrasound indicated GB wall inflammation without visible stones, supporting a diagnosis of possible gallstone pancreatitis.
